attributes.action: Give parents & carers the right to opt their child out of All aspects of RE/RSE.
attributes.additional_details:
We have grave concerns about the physical psychological and moral implications of teaching children about certain sexual and relationship concepts proposed in RE/RSE, before they are emotionally ready and physiologically mature, as concerned parents/carers we object to the age group this is aimed at. 
We are concerned that various sexual identity lobby groups will use the new RE/RSE curriculum as a opportunity to promote their viewpoint at the expense the traditional nuclear family.
attributes.background: As concerned parents and UK citizens we want to be able to exercise our rights as parents/carers to be able to choose to opt our children out of ALL aspects of the new Relationships Education and Relationships & Sex Education curriculum that will become mandatory in all English Schools from 2020.
